thread.title: AAMCO Set To Break Ground At Site Of Future Service Center In Bristol, Penn., Sept. 25
thread.title_full: AAMCO Set To Break Ground At Site Of Future Service Center In Bristol, Penn., Sept. 25 - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: AAMCO Set To Break Ground At Site Of Future Service Center In Bristol, Penn., Sept. 25
text:
AAMCO
Leader in Total Car Care to Relocate Existing Pennsylvania Location to New, Larger Service Center
HORSHAM, Pa. , Sept. 24, AAMCO , the world's largest chain of transmission specialists and leader in total car care announces a groundbreaking ceremony for its new Bristol, Penn. , location on Friday, Sept. 25 at 9:30 a.m. at 2520-26 Durham Road. Town Council President Craig Bowen and Rob Rajkowski , chief operating officer of AAMCO will be attending the ceremony.
AAMCO's existing service center located at 5300 Bristol-Emilie Road, which opened in May 2002 , is owned and operated by husband-and-wife team Sam and Sherri Underland . The franchisees plan to relocate to their new, larger service center at the Durham Road location in the first quarter of 2016.
"Over the last 13 years, Sam and I have had the pleasure of providing the community with total car care service, and we are excited to share this special occasion with local residents and dignitaries," said Sherri Underland . "We've finally found the perfect site for our business and look forward to serving both new and existing customers for years to come."
"The Underlands are one of our most progressive franchisees," says Rob Rajkowski , chief operating officer of AAMCO. "They continue to embrace the AAMCO business model, and we are thrilled to see all of their hard work and dedication pay off with their new state-of-the-art AAMCO center. The community is getting a pair of owners dedicated to serving their customers' needs."
The AAMCO in Bristol will feature 10 bays, including two quick lube bays and serve customers seven days a week.
For over 50 years, AAMCO's locally owned and operated independent service centers have employed the latest technology. Expert technicians diagnose a repair, fix it right the first time, and back it with a nationwide warranty. Known as the world's leading transmission expert, the company has evolved into a total car care brand providing a variety of services including brake repairs, tune-ups, shocks and struts, routine maintenance and more. AAMCO was recently named to Entrepreneur's 2015 Franchise 500 Â® . The system size, growth rate, and financial strength also earned the brand the top spot in the transmission repair category on Entrepreneur's "Best of the Best" list.
For more information about the AAMCO in Bristol , please visit www.aamcolevittownpa.com or call 215-949-1400.
About AAMCO
AAMCO is the world's largest chain of transmission specialists and a leader in total car care services. AAMCO has nearly 700 automotive centers throughout the United States and Canada . Established in 1962, AAMCO centers are proud to have served more than 45 million drivers. For more information, visit aamcouniversity.com , aamco.com or aamcoblog.com .

Andie Biederman
